name: places/ChIJKY_bJ5JZwokRhFfEO7KDagI
formattedAddress: 99 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 99 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cozy underground bar featuring up-&-coming comedians & open-mike events 7 nights a week.

originalText.text: We were on a trip to NY and wanted to see a comedy show in Greenwich Village and several of the larger clubs were sold out so we got tickets to this place and after looking at reviews we became a little skeptical.  But gave it a shot. It is very very small, so get prepared to sit right next to a stranger but our sides were in stitches. We laughed so dang hard. The drinks were tasty and strong. There were a ton of comics, quick sets.  Some hit harder than others, some awkwardness,  some crowd roasting, some know how to work a room better than others but overall it was an excellent experience.  Would absolutely come again. The bathrooms were rly bad tho. Haha so hold it!

originalText.text: Not a four star experience and I would pay for tickets, but if you get free tickets on Eventbrite ahead of time it’s not a bad pre dinner activity. Comedians are ok, definitely hit or miss. Lots of repeats though so if you go back you may hear the same sets. Two drink minimum and gratuity is automatically added.

text.text: Not a four star experience and I would pay for tickets, but if you get free tickets on Eventbrite ahead of time it’s not a bad pre dinner activity. Comedians are ok, definitely hit or miss. Lots of repeats though so if you go back you may hear the same sets. Two drink minimum and gratuity is automatically added.

originalText.text: First time at a comedy club in NYC in October 2021. I accidentally went down when they were having their open mic set. I struck up the courage to do a short set. I had nothing prepared but mostly joked about the woes of Tinder dating and how in Wisconsin you must hold a fish. I would come back and maybe get up to perform now that I have the material. The full show was spectacular and loved the wine I had. Great hole-in-the-wall place.

originalText.text:
Overpriced for what it was. Its worse than the cellar and no better than the bar show. Comics were all rushed. Place was cramped. 20 to get in and minimum of 30 inside for drinks. No food options.

If you really want a good show go to the cellar. If you want an ok show, save your money and go to a bar

originalText.text: We purchase at 9:30 show tickets and it said that you would be able to come in at 9 o’clock we got here at maybe at 9:08 and the guy at the door said they were not letting anyone in until 920 which led me to believe maybe she was going to be empty because we pass back by at like 915 still nobody in the prescribed line. The venue was super tiny. Don’t expect to have any Wi-Fi because it’s in a down stairs. During the show there was a heckler who was aggravating to everyone who did not get kicked out which he should have and he kinda like messed the show up for others
